question: Which of the following is highest waterfall of Madhya Pradesh?
explanation:
Chachai Falls is 130 meters high situated on beehad river a tributary to Tons or Tamsa in Rewa district.
Purva fall is situated in Rewa district on Tons River and has a height of 70 metres.
Keoti fall is on Mahana river a tributary to Tons and Tamsa.It has a height of 98 metres.
Dhuandhar fall is in Jabalpur on Narmada River.It has a height of 30 metres
